wikipedia_page.main: Lewis Cobden Thomas (6 August 1865 – 14 April 1928) was a Welsh international rugby union forward who played club rugby for Neath and Cardiff Rugby Football Club and international rugby for Wales. In 1900 he became the Mayor of Neath.

response: *14 April – Lewis Cobden Thomas, Wales international rugby player, 62
*6 August — Lewis Cobden Thomas, Wales international rugby player (died 1928)
**Lewis Cobden Thomas (1865–1928), Wales international rugby union footballer

Rowland was awarded his first and only cap for Wales while still at Lampeter University. Played against England as part of the 1895 Home Nations Championship, Rowland was brought into the Welsh pack alongside fellow debuts Lewis Cobden Thomas and Evan Richards. This was the fourth time Wales had played England, and just like the three previous matches England were victorious over the Welsh team. Rowland was replaced for the next game, against Ireland, by Willie Thomas of Llandovery College, and never represented Wales again.
* Lewis Cobden Thomas (1865–1928), Welsh international rugby union forward
